channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fridge dumped on street, 6th October
item.description:
Hi there, there is a fridge that has been fly tipped on Cator St, by the cut through to Sumner Road. Please could this be removed. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): East Surrey Grove, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trip hazard, 6th October
item.description:
When leaving Buzz Bingo on 1st OCTOBER 2025 at 10.15pm I was with my neighbour holding on to her arm we both ended up on the ground resulting in severe bruising and swelling to our knees and pulls to other parts of body

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Broadway, Barnehurst, London

item.title: Potholes, 6th October
item.description:
These potholes and uneven surface has been here for years. You can hear the cars go down the hole as the back of my property is on Tanyard Lane. I understand this part of Tanyard Lane comes under the council. Thanks Sharon 36c High Street Bexley DA51AH

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tanyard Lane, Bexley, London

item.title: Abandoned Bike, 6th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montpelier Avenue, Albany Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Beehive near school, 6th October
item.description:
A beehive has been spotted very close to Surrey Square Primary school. On the pathway between surrey square park and The church of the lord. A few children have been stung by bees over the past couple weeks on their way into school. Many families use that pathway to get kids into school so we are concerned. It would be great if the hive can be removed
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Surrey Square, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged Fencing Sidcup Cemetery, 6th October
item.description:
The fencing is damaged along the footpath adjacent to the cemetery. People can gain access to the cemetery even when it is closed. On a recent visit a man walked into the cemetery this way. Sadly cemeteries are prone to vandalism & having no proper fence in place makes it vulnerable to this. This would be very upsetting to those who have loved ones interred here.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Penfold Lane, Albany Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
